_header: How the crown must be kept from covetous people
Note: See 503 for the companion piece, Richard the Redeless.
Subjects: contemporary conditions; Richard II, deposition of; national policy, discussions of; alliterative unrhymed
_description: Mum and the Sothsegger — alliterative lines

BLAdd41666.First Lines:
Hovgh þe coronne moste be kepte fro couetous peupleAl hoole in
                    his hande and at his heeste eke…
BLAdd41666.Last Lines:
…[...]ourchachid no prelacies with prince noþer
                    elles[...]yer ne povndes but þorough proufe of þayre
                    workes
BLAdd41666.Note:
1751 lines; ends imperfectly. Initial words of last lines are missing
                    due to damage to the manuscript.
BLAdd41666.Editions:
Day,  Mabel,  and  Richard Steele, eds.  
             Mum and the Sothsegger.
EETS
         o.s. 199 (1936); repr. 1987. 
Dean,  James M.,
                        ed.  
             Richard the Redeless
                    and Mum and the Sothsegger.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2000.
